document_metadata.name: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

citation.name: Cell reports
citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

links.evidence: The ATP-dependent chaperones are comprised of the 5 HSP90s, 17 HSP70s, 14 HSP60s, 6 ER-speciﬁc, and 8 MITO-speciﬁc Hsp100/AAA+ ATPases, respectively.

citation.name: Cell reports
citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

links.evidence: The ATP-dependent chaperones are comprised of the 5 HSP90s, 17 HSP70s, 14 HSP60s, 6 ER-speciﬁc, and 8 MITO-speciﬁc Hsp100/AAA+ ATPases, respectively.

citation.name: Cell reports
citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

links.evidence: The ATP-dependent chaperones are comprised of the 5 HSP90s, 17 HSP70s, 14 HSP60s, 6 ER-speciﬁc, and 8 MITO-speciﬁc Hsp100/AAA+ ATPases, respectively.

citation.name: Cell reports
citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

links.evidence: The ATP-dependent chaperones are comprised of the 5 HSP90s, 17 HSP70s, 14 HSP60s, 6 ER-speciﬁc, and 8 MITO-speciﬁc Hsp100/AAA+ ATPases, respectively.

citation.name: Cell reports
citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

links.evidence: This functional screen identiﬁed 18 genes (Figure 3D), corresponding to ten ATP-dependent chaperones, HSC70 (hsp-1), HSP90 (daf-21), and eight subunits of the CCT/TRiC chaperonin complex; the co-chaperones, HSP40 (dnj-12) and CDC37 (cdc-37); and the TPR-domain pro- tein STI1 that upon knockdown signiﬁcantly enhanced A b 42 pro- teotoxicity (Figure 3D).

citation.name: Cell reports
citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

links.evidence: Knockdown of daf-21 (HSP90) or hsp-1 (HSC70) led to increased paralysis in 45% and 44% of day 6 animals, respectively, and knockdown of TPR co-chaper- ones tpr-1 and dnj-12 resulted in 70% impairment (Figure S4D).

citation.name: Cell reports
citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

links.evidence: The ATP-dependent chaperones are comprised of the 5 HSP90s, 17 HSP70s, 14 HSP60s, 6 ER-speciﬁc, and 8 MITO-speciﬁc Hsp100/AAA+ ATPases, respectively.

citation.name: Cell reports
citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

links.evidence: The ATP-dependent chaperones are comprised of the 5 HSP90s, 17 HSP70s, 14 HSP60s, 6 ER-speciﬁc, and 8 MITO-speciﬁc Hsp100/AAA+ ATPases, respectively.

citation.name: Cell reports
citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

links.evidence: TPR proteins tend to be induced, whereas HSP40s are repressed (Figure 1B).

citation.name: Cell reports
citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

links.evidence: Ranked by decreasing median aging correlation, the induction of sHSPs and TPR genes consistently ranked high and the HSP60s, HSP40s, and HSP70s were consistently repressed.

citation.name: Cell reports
citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

links.evidence: Among the genes that are induced in brain aging and disease are sHSPs and TPR-containing chaperone genes (Figures S3A–S3D).

citation.name: Cell reports
citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

links.evidence: TPR proteins tend to be induced, whereas HSP40s are repressed (Figure 1B).

citation.name: Cell reports
citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

links.evidence: Among the genes that are repressed in both aging and AD, the HSP70- HSP40 system corresponds to 36% of the 58 genes (Table S3D).

citation.name: Cell reports
citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

links.evidence: Ranked by decreasing median aging correlation, the induction of sHSPs and TPR genes consistently ranked high and the HSP60s, HSP40s, and HSP70s were consistently repressed.

citation.name: Cell reports
citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

links.evidence: Among repressed genes, the HSP40s exhibited signiﬁcant change (p = 0.04875), with 62% of 48 HSP40 genes repressed in aging (p < 0.05) and 51% repressed in AD.

citation.name: Cell reports
citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

links.evidence: Among the genes that are repressed in both aging and AD, the HSP70- HSP40 system corresponds to 36% of the 58 genes (Table S3D).

links.evidence: Ranked by decreasing median aging correlation, the induction of sHSPs and TPR genes consistently ranked high and the HSP60s, HSP40s, and HSP70s were consistently repressed.

citation.name: Cell reports
citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

links.evidence: Among the genes that are induced in brain aging and disease are sHSPs and TPR-containing chaperone genes (Figures S3A–S3D).

citation.name: Cell reports
citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

links.evidence: Ranked by decreasing median aging correlation, the induction of sHSPs and TPR genes consistently ranked high and the HSP60s, HSP40s, and HSP70s were consistently repressed.

citation.name: Cell reports
citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

links.evidence: For example, concordantly aggravated expression pat- terns for the aging-induced genes HSPA2 (HSP70) and DNAJB2 (HSP40) and the aging-repressed HSPA12A (HSP70) and TOMM70A (TPR) were observed in brain biopsies from AD, HD, and PD patients (Figure 2C).

citation.name: Cell reports
citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

citation.name: Cell reports
citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

links.evidence: Four genes that are signiﬁcantly repressed both in AD and HD (HSP90AB1, HSPA8, HSPA14, and TCP1) are also repressed in aging (Figure 6B).

citation.name: Cell reports
citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

links.evidence: Four genes that are signiﬁcantly repressed both in AD and HD (HSP90AB1, HSPA8, HSPA14, and TCP1) are also repressed in aging (Figure 6B).

citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

links.evidence: This functional screen identiﬁed 18 genes (Figure 3D), corresponding to ten ATP-dependent chaperones, HSC70 (hsp-1), HSP90 (daf-21), and eight subunits of the CCT/TRiC chaperonin complex; the co-chaperones, HSP40 (dnj-12) and CDC37 (cdc-37); and the TPR-domain pro- tein STI1 that upon knockdown signiﬁcantly enhanced A b 42 pro- teotoxicity (Figure 3D).

citation.name: Cell reports
citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

links.evidence: Knockdown of daf-21 (HSP90) or hsp-1 (HSC70) led to increased paralysis in 45% and 44% of day 6 animals, respectively, and knockdown of TPR co-chaper- ones tpr-1 and dnj-12 resulted in 70% impairment (Figure S4D).

citation.name: Cell reports
citation.title: A chaperome subnetwork safeguards proteostasis in aging and neurodegenerative disease.

links.evidence: These included all subunits of the CCT/TRiC complex (except CCT5); HSP40 and HSP70 family members DNAJA1 (HDJ-2), DNAJA4, HSPA8 (HSC70), and HSPA14 (Figures 5B and 5C); and the TPR-domain APC/C subunits CDC23 and CDC27 that, upon knockdown, led to signiﬁcantly elevated aggregation (Figure S5B).
